thread.title: North East news LIVE: Latest breaking news, sport, weather, traffic and travel
thread.title_full: North East news LIVE: Latest breaking news, sport, weather, traffic and travel

author: Katie Collings
title: North East news LIVE: Latest breaking news, sport, weather, traffic and travel
text:
Our reporter Sean is now at the rally: 11:39 Katie Collings Update from police about Winlaton incident 
A spokesman for Northumbria Police could not give further details about the incident in Winlaton where a man has been arrested after allegedly being seen with a knife. 
He said: 
“I can confirm an incident has taken place in which there is an investigation ongoing.” 
We are hoping to have an update from police later today. 11:27 Katie Collings Queues on the A1 
Highways England says there is still heavy congestion on the A1(M) Southbound near Bowburn due to the earlier collision. 
One lane is now open but there are expected delays of up to 50 minutes. 11:19 Katie Collings What is it about? 
Campaigners for peace and social justice are to join forces with trades unionists and Labour politicians. (Photo: PA) 
Chi Onwurah is expected to comment on key issues in the general election campaign. 
Speaking before the rally she said: 
“For the Labour Party, our historic mission is to defend and extend the rights of working people. This is especially important when the hard-won rights of working people are under threat. 
“Here in the UK, a Tory Government is pursuing a hard Brexit agenda that threatens to trade away our socio-economic birthright.” 
She will be joined on the platform by Laura Pidcock, recently appointed Labour candidate for North West Durham, Craig Johnston from rail and maritime union RMT, Anne Stokle from the Burma Campaign UK and Jorge Garcia, political counsellor at the Cuban Embassy. 
Other speakers will address such issues as the NHS crisis, school under-funding and solidarity with Palestine. 
May Day Committee chair Martin Levy says: 
“The announcement of the general election has made it all the more important that the issues affecting working people are heard. We expect a determined and colorful turnout, with the march led as usual by the Backworth Colliery Band.” 11:08 Katie Collings 'No to austerity' march in Newcastle 
Campaigners will march through Newcastle city centre today in a May Day rally to say: “No to war, poverty and racism”. 
This year’s slogan couples “workers’ rights and internationalism” with opposition to “war, poverty and racism”, echoing the call made 50 years ago by Dr Martin Luther King Jr, when he was awarded an honorary degree by Newcastle University. 
Newcastle Central MP Chi Onwurah will be the keynote speaker. 
We will be there bringing you live updates. 10:54 Katie Collings Breakdown on the A19 
One lane is closed on the A19 Southbound between the A184 Newcastle Road near Testo’s Roundabout and the A1290 due to a broken down vehicle. 
Traffic is said to be coping well. 10:47 Katie Collings Man arrested in Winlaton 
If you’ve seen a lot of officers in Winlaton this is why. We’ll bring you updates when we have them: 10:36
